blog.description: I write but I’m not very good at it

summary: Finding out steve only dated you because you’re a carter
body:
Finding out steve only dated you because you’re a carter

• you’d find out by accident,

• you’d accidentally overhear him talking to Bucky or read an open page of his diary

• it would all be about Peggy

• stories about her, things that you told him.

• you’d try to ignore it, thinking that he might have just been thinking about her more than usual that day

• but then you’ll notice how much he mentions her

• or asks about her

• you’d confront him alone, telling him how you feel

• he’d probably deny it at first but then admit it

• he’d cry

• you’d probably cry aswell

• steve honestly hates himself for it, but he was still in love with Peggy

• “was any of it real?”

“no”

“not even some of it?”



A/N: I had absolutely no idea how to end this. Please send in requests!

blog.name: allthetonyships
blog.title: otp: tony/happiness
blog.description: liz • main • exploding with love for tony stark • guidelines • requests: temporarily closed

summary: Would you be up for writing asexual Tony who is secretly a virgin who is repulsed by sex? He managed to fool everyone that he is...
question: Would you be up for writing asexual Tony who is secretly a virgin who is repulsed by sex? He managed to fool everyone that he is a playboy, but it's not the case. But now he is in a relationship with Pepper, and he needs to tell her. He is scared of that will happen when he does.
answer:
author’s note: as an asexual in a relationship myself, this story was very personal for me to write. I haven’t received negative comments on my fics ever, but I do want to ask that anyone who has a problem with asexuality keeps scrolling without a comment. Acephobia is neither needed nor wanted.

————————–

He’d thought he was broken, when he was younger. It hadn’t taken him a long time to figure out; as the son of the rich genius Howard Stark, the heir to his ground-breaking company, people threw themselves at Tony. The world of billionaires is one of money, booze, and most importantly, sex.

Tony was fine with the first two. The latter? Not so much. He’d known that pretty much since he was led to a bed by the first person who wanted to sleep with him. She’d been a pretty girl, and Tony thought she was stunning to look at – he was sixteen, and she’d been eighteen, and Tony didn’t have a lot of experience, but he really thought he was going to lose his virginity there.

He’d panicked at the realization he didn’t want to sleep with her – in fact, even the thought of doing so brought out a repulsion for the act he wasn’t aware he had. Sex was something he’d thought he’d get used to, once he finally did it. Everyone was always going on about how it was the most natural thing in the world, about how great it was; sex was everywhere, and even as a teenager, it was something people expected him to have.

Tony found out he was asexual at sixteen, but it’s not something he shared with the rest of the world; the world, obsessed with sex, would never understand.

He carefully built a reputation by taking girls to bed that would be too drunk to even remember what actually happened. He knows what they would assume, though, and what the rest of the world would. Tony wasn’t relationship material, anyway, so it was fine that way. No one had to figure out, and no one was going to.

Tony is fine, until he falls in love with Pepper Potts, some thirty-odd years later.

~*~

‘’Tony? Are you still coming up?’’ Pepper asks. She’s standing in the door opening of the lab. Tony looks up from where he’s working on the car engine. He’s been playing around with them in his free time.

‘’Hmm?’’ he hums. ‘’Yeah, yeah, give me a minute.’’

It has been three weeks, since he first kissed her on that rooftop, after the events with Vanko and SHIELD and almost dying, that kind of thing.

She’s been staying over multiple times, since then, and – well, Tony likes it. He loves Pepper, and he loves spending time with her. She’s everything he could ever want. He’d have kissed her a lot sooner, if not for the fact – well. The fact that his sexuality will probably ruin any chance he has with her. As much as he loves their days together, he dreads the coming of night. He dreads the day that Pepper will make her move, and try to take the next step as a couple. He knows she’s already slightly confused by the fact that he hasn’t, but he doesn’t know how to explain.

He doesn’t want to lose her. Not to this, this thing he has no control over. He’s long accepted that he doesn’t want sex; it’s been easy enough to build up a reputation as playboy, so no one else even knows. The media, by this point, simply assumes that he sleeps with everyone he makes eyes at. People certainly talk enough about his prowess in bed; it’d be laughable, if it didn’t remind Tony how ridiculous it is that people are desperate enough to lie about sleeping with him for their own reputation.

‘’Tony,’’ Pepper repeats, her tone in between fond and annoyed, something he’s very used to. She comes over to him, kissing him lightly on the lips. ‘’The car will still be there tomorrow. I need to be up early, so I really want to go to bed. Are you going to join me or not?’’

Tony smiles at her. He can’t refuse those eyes. ‘’Yeah, I’m coming,’’ he says, wiping the oil off his hands on his pants.

~*~

‘’I’ve been thinking,’’ Pepper says, as they lie in bed. Tony tries not to tense; anything Pepper says in bed that could lead to ‘we should have sex’ or anything close to it usually makes him nervous. ‘’How would you feel about going away for a while, soon? I think it’d be nice. We both deserve a vacation, after this whole thing with Vanko, and your illness. If you want to?’’

‘’I thought you couldn’t bear to be away from the company,’’ Tony says, rolling over to face her. ‘’Why do you want to go away now?’’

Her hair is falling over her face, as she meets his eyes. Tony likes her eyes; they’re kind and beautiful, and he wants to stare at them forever.

She shrugs a little. ‘’That was before I knew that you were sick,’’ she points out.

‘’I’m not anymore,’’ Tony says. ‘’You don’t think I still am, do you? Pepper, honestly, I’m perfectly healthy. I’ve even been to a doctor to get that confirmed.’’

‘’Because I made you,’’ Pepper says, and she’s frowning. ‘’I don’t know, Tony. I feel like you haven’t been you, lately. We were fine, before – well, before. But you keep staring at me, now, and you flinch if I touch you. I feel like you’re keeping something from me.’’

Shit. Tony feels the panic rise inside, clawing at him, and he sits up. Pepper joins him, staring at him in concern. She’s going to ask, now, and Tony can’t lie to her. He would, but it’s not going to work out in the long term. He can’t keep leading her on. How long is he going to keep this up, anyway? How long is it going to be until Pepper leaves, to search for someone who can keep her satisfied?

‘’Tony?’’ he hears her say, but it’s like she’s far away. ‘’Tony, talk to me. What’s wrong?’’

He shakes his head, trying to keep in his tears. ‘’It’s not – fuck. Pepper, I’m sorry, okay? I’m sorry.’’

‘’What are you sorry about?’’ she asks, confused. She lays a hand on his arm, and it steadies him a bit. It only makes him mourn more.

‘’I’m afraid of losing you,’’ he answers, choked up. ‘’I’m afraid, all right, because you’re the best thing that has ever happened to me. You’re all I have, and you’re all I want to ever have. We’ve been doing this dance for only a few weeks, but I love you. I’ve loved you for a long time, and now you’re here.’’

‘’Tony, I’m here,’’ Pepper says. ‘’I’m not going to leave, because I love you, too. Get that into your head, okay? You’re not going to lose me.’’

‘’Why do you think I’m not being myself?’’ he forces out. ‘’Tell me, Pepper. Why were you thinking I wasn’t being myself?’’

Pepper is slightly taken aback, but like the composed woman she is, she answers quickly and candidly enough. ‘’Well, it’s – because you flinch. You don’t seem to be comfortable, when I’m sleeping over. I thought you wanted this relationship, but so far, you haven’t tried a single time to have sex with me yet. And, Tony, I’m fine with taking it slow, if that’s what you want.’’

Tony sighs, closing his eyes for only a moment before meeting Pepper’s anxious ones again. He should know to expect it when people throw around ‘sex’ and ‘relationship’ in the same sentence, as if they’re synonyms. ‘’I’m not fine with taking it slow,’’ he says. ‘’And that means the exact opposite of what you think it’ll mean. Pepper, I don’t want to have sex. And it’s not because I don’t love you, or because I’m not attracted to you. I’m asexual.’’

‘’You’re – what?’’ Pepper says, tilting her head suddenly. ‘’But – everyone always –‘’

‘’I know,’’ Tony says, with a self-deprecating smile. ‘’Neat little trick, isn’t it? I haven’t ever had sex, Pepper. Tabloids are all lies, every single one. I’m a virgin, and I’m fine with that. Enough people are desperate to say they’ve slept with me, and it’s always been that way. I let it go on, because it’s easier like that. Thing is, I don’t want sex. It freaks me out. I don’t see the appeal.’’

Pepper is silent for a little while, and then takes his hands. ‘’Tony,’’ she says. ‘’This is not a turn of events I saw coming, honestly, with all the women I’ve ushered out of your house –‘’

‘’Very drunk,’’ Tony says. ‘’Honestly, it’s so easy.’’

Her lips quirk into a slight smile. ‘’Point is, I love you. If you don’t want to have sex, that’s fine. I love you for you, and I brought it up because I was afraid you were doubting our relationship.’’

‘’I’ve never been more certain about anything in my life,’’ Tony says quickly. ‘’I love you, Pepper. It’s just – I’ve never been in a real relationship. I don’t want you to leave.’’

‘’You’re an idiot,’’ she says, and kisses his head. ‘’We all have our boundaries, Tony. You just have to tell me where yours are. Are you okay with kissing?’’

‘’Definitely,’’ Tony says. ‘’Kisses and cuddles, my favourite things. Look, Pepper – I’m sorry. I know that sex is this thing that everyone universally wants, and people just assume you’re having it when you’re in a relationship. People assume you’re having it, anyway. I feel like I’m letting you down.’’

‘’You’re you, you couldn’t ever,’’ she says. ‘’I love you, Tony, okay? I’m just glad you told me.’’

‘’I wish I wanted it,’’ Tony mutters, leaning against her. ‘’I want to want it, okay? But I don’t. I really, really, really don’t. I don’t get why everyone is so focused on having sex.’’

She enfolds him in her arms. ‘’I love you, and that’s the most important thing,’’ she says. ‘’I want you to be comfortable, Tony. It’s going to be okay, Tony. You told me, I’m still here, we’re fine. I’m not going to force you to do anything you don’t want to do.’’

‘’But maybe you’ll leave,’’ he mutters, trying not to sound like a kicked puppy.

She kisses him, again. ‘’Maybe,’’ she says. ‘’We’ve only been dating for a few weeks, and I don’t know what will happen. But it won’t be because you’re asexual, Tony. And it won’t be without warning. You have no idea how much I love you, and I’m not giving up on you.’’

‘’I love you too,’’ Tony says, clinging to her. Relief is flooding through his body, though there’s still a great part of guilt, surprise, and disbelief present as well. Some part of him still thinks that Pepper will pack up and leave, and if it’s not right now, then in a week, a month, a year.

She is still holding him, though, pressing soft kisses against his hair, and he dares to hope. That maybe it’ll work out anyway, that Pepper will stay. She isn’t leaving now, certainly, she seems to be clinging to him even more closely than before. If he really believes that she means it, that she loves him, then maybe they’ll get through this, as well.

‘’It’s not going to change, you know that, right?’’ he asks.

‘’I don’t need you to change,’’ Pepper says firmly. ‘’I think you’re perfectly fine the way you are. I love all of you. All of you, Tony. And you may not believe that right now, but I do.’’

‘’Me too,’’ he says, somewhat dumbfounded.

‘’I’ll keep telling you until you believe it,’’ she whispers. ‘’You’re worthy of being loved, Tony. You really are.’’

She keeps whispering, and Tony closes his eyes as he listens to her. Maybe he can try to believe her. This feeling, the feeling of not being enough, it won’t go away on its own, and it won’t go away without trying very hard. Pepper hugs him, though, kisses and loves him, and that helps.

It helps, and Tony breathes.

author’s note: as an asexual in a relationship myself, this story was very personal for me to write. I haven’t received negative comments on my fics ever, but I do want to ask that anyone who has a problem with asexuality keeps scrolling without a comment. Acephobia is neither needed nor wanted.

————————–

He’d thought he was broken, when he was younger. It hadn’t taken him a long time to figure out; as the son of the rich genius Howard Stark, the heir to his ground-breaking company, people threw themselves at Tony. The world of billionaires is one of money, booze, and most importantly, sex.

Tony was fine with the first two. The latter? Not so much. He’d known that pretty much since he was led to a bed by the first person who wanted to sleep with him. She’d been a pretty girl, and Tony thought she was stunning to look at – he was sixteen, and she’d been eighteen, and Tony didn’t have a lot of experience, but he really thought he was going to lose his virginity there.

He’d panicked at the realization he didn’t want to sleep with her – in fact, even the thought of doing so brought out a repulsion for the act he wasn’t aware he had. Sex was something he’d thought he’d get used to, once he finally did it. Everyone was always going on about how it was the most natural thing in the world, about how great it was; sex was everywhere, and even as a teenager, it was something people expected him to have.

Tony found out he was asexual at sixteen, but it’s not something he shared with the rest of the world; the world, obsessed with sex, would never understand.

‘’I’ve never been more certain about anything in my life,’’ Tony says quickly. ‘’I love you, Pepper. It’s just – I’ve never been in a real relationship. I don’t want you to leave.’’

‘’You’re an idiot,’’ she says, and kisses his head. ‘’We all have our boundaries, Tony. You just have to tell me where yours are. Are you okay with kissing?’’

‘’Definitely,’’ Tony says. ‘’Kisses and cuddles, my favourite things. Look, Pepper – I’m sorry. I know that sex is this thing that everyone universally wants, and people just assume you’re having it when you’re in a relationship. People assume you’re having it, anyway. I feel like I’m letting you down.’’

‘’You’re you, you couldn’t ever,’’ she says. ‘’I love you, Tony, okay? I’m just glad you told me.’’

‘’I wish I wanted it,’’ Tony mutters, leaning against her. ‘’I want to want it, okay? But I don’t. I really, really, really don’t. I don’t get why everyone is so focused on having sex.’’

She enfolds him in her arms. ‘’I love you, and that’s the most important thing,’’ she says. ‘’I want you to be comfortable, Tony. It’s going to be okay, Tony. You told me, I’m still here, we’re fine. I’m not going to force you to do anything you don’t want to do.’’

‘’But maybe you’ll leave,’’ he mutters, trying not to sound like a kicked puppy.

She kisses him, again. ‘’Maybe,’’ she says. ‘’We’ve only been dating for a few weeks, and I don’t know what will happen. But it won’t be because you’re asexual, Tony. And it won’t be without warning. You have no idea how much I love you, and I’m not giving up on you.’’

‘’I love you too,’’ Tony says, clinging to her. Relief is flooding through his body, though there’s still a great part of guilt, surprise, and disbelief present as well. Some part of him still thinks that Pepper will pack up and leave, and if it’s not right now, then in a week, a month, a year.

She is still holding him, though, pressing soft kisses against his hair, and he dares to hope. That maybe it’ll work out anyway, that Pepper will stay. She isn’t leaving now, certainly, she seems to be clinging to him even more closely than before. If he really believes that she means it, that she loves him, then maybe they’ll get through this, as well.

‘’It’s not going to change, you know that, right?’’ he asks.

‘’I don’t need you to change,’’ Pepper says firmly. ‘’I think you’re perfectly fine the way you are. I love all of you. All of you, Tony. And you may not believe that right now, but I do.’’

‘’Me too,’’ he says, somewhat dumbfounded.

‘’I’ll keep telling you until you believe it,’’ she whispers. ‘’You’re worthy of being loved, Tony. You really are.’’

She keeps whispering, and Tony closes his eyes as he listens to her. Maybe he can try to believe her. This feeling, the feeling of not being enough, it won’t go away on its own, and it won’t go away without trying very hard. Pepper hugs him, though, kisses and loves him, and that helps.

It helps, and Tony breathes.

————————–

He’d thought he was broken, when he was younger. It hadn’t taken him a long time to figure out; as the son of the rich genius Howard Stark, the heir to his ground-breaking company, people threw themselves at Tony. The world of billionaires is one of money, booze, and most importantly, sex.

Tony was fine with the first two. The latter? Not so much. He’d known that pretty much since he was led to a bed by the first person who wanted to sleep with him. She’d been a pretty girl, and Tony thought she was stunning to look at – he was sixteen, and she’d been eighteen, and Tony didn’t have a lot of experience, but he really thought he was going to lose his virginity there.

He’d panicked at the realization he didn’t want to sleep with her – in fact, even the thought of doing so brought out a repulsion for the act he wasn’t aware he had. Sex was something he’d thought he’d get used to, once he finally did it. Everyone was always going on about how it was the most natural thing in the world, about how great it was; sex was everywhere, and even as a teenager, it was something people expected him to have.

Tony found out he was asexual at sixteen, but it’s not something he shared with the rest of the world; the world, obsessed with sex, would never understand.

He carefully built a reputation by taking girls to bed that would be too drunk to even remember what actually happened. He knows what they would assume, though, and what the rest of the world would. Tony wasn’t relationship material, anyway, so it was fine that way. No one had to figure out, and no one was going to.

Tony is fine, until he falls in love with Pepper Potts, some thirty-odd years later.

~*~

‘’Tony? Are you still coming up?’’ Pepper asks. She’s standing in the door opening of the lab. Tony looks up from where he’s working on the car engine. He’s been playing around with them in his free time.

‘’Hmm?’’ he hums. ‘’Yeah, yeah, give me a minute.’’

It has been three weeks, since he first kissed her on that rooftop, after the events with Vanko and SHIELD and almost dying, that kind of thing.

She’s been staying over multiple times, since then, and – well, Tony likes it. He loves Pepper, and he loves spending time with her. She’s everything he could ever want. He’d have kissed her a lot sooner, if not for the fact – well. The fact that his sexuality will probably ruin any chance he has with her. As much as he loves their days together, he dreads the coming of night. He dreads the day that Pepper will make her move, and try to take the next step as a couple. He knows she’s already slightly confused by the fact that he hasn’t, but he doesn’t know how to explain.

He doesn’t want to lose her. Not to this, this thing he has no control over. He’s long accepted that he doesn’t want sex; it’s been easy enough to build up a reputation as playboy, so no one else even knows. The media, by this point, simply assumes that he sleeps with everyone he makes eyes at. People certainly talk enough about his prowess in bed; it’d be laughable, if it didn’t remind Tony how ridiculous it is that people are desperate enough to lie about sleeping with him for their own reputation.

‘’Tony,’’ Pepper repeats, her tone in between fond and annoyed, something he’s very used to. She comes over to him, kissing him lightly on the lips. ‘’The car will still be there tomorrow. I need to be up early, so I really want to go to bed. Are you going to join me or not?’’

Tony smiles at her. He can’t refuse those eyes. ‘’Yeah, I’m coming,’’ he says, wiping the oil off his hands on his pants.

~*~

‘’I’ve been thinking,’’ Pepper says, as they lie in bed. Tony tries not to tense; anything Pepper says in bed that could lead to ‘we should have sex’ or anything close to it usually makes him nervous. ‘’How would you feel about going away for a while, soon? I think it’d be nice. We both deserve a vacation, after this whole thing with Vanko, and your illness. If you want to?’’

‘’I thought you couldn’t bear to be away from the company,’’ Tony says, rolling over to face her. ‘’Why do you want to go away now?’’

Her hair is falling over her face, as she meets his eyes. Tony likes her eyes; they’re kind and beautiful, and he wants to stare at them forever.

She shrugs a little. ‘’That was before I knew that you were sick,’’ she points out.

‘’I’m not anymore,’’ Tony says. ‘’You don’t think I still am, do you? Pepper, honestly, I’m perfectly healthy. I’ve even been to a doctor to get that confirmed.’’

‘’Because I made you,’’ Pepper says, and she’s frowning. ‘’I don’t know, Tony. I feel like you haven’t been you, lately. We were fine, before – well, before. But you keep staring at me, now, and you flinch if I touch you. I feel like you’re keeping something from me.’’

Shit. Tony feels the panic rise inside, clawing at him, and he sits up. Pepper joins him, staring at him in concern. She’s going to ask, now, and Tony can’t lie to her. He would, but it’s not going to work out in the long term. He can’t keep leading her on. How long is he going to keep this up, anyway? How long is it going to be until Pepper leaves, to search for someone who can keep her satisfied?

‘’Tony?’’ he hears her say, but it’s like she’s far away. ‘’Tony, talk to me. What’s wrong?’’

He shakes his head, trying to keep in his tears. ‘’It’s not – fuck. Pepper, I’m sorry, okay? I’m sorry.’’

‘’What are you sorry about?’’ she asks, confused. She lays a hand on his arm, and it steadies him a bit. It only makes him mourn more.

‘’I’m afraid of losing you,’’ he answers, choked up. ‘’I’m afraid, all right, because you’re the best thing that has ever happened to me. You’re all I have, and you’re all I want to ever have. We’ve been doing this dance for only a few weeks, but I love you. I’ve loved you for a long time, and now you’re here.’’

‘’Tony, I’m here,’’ Pepper says. ‘’I’m not going to leave, because I love you, too. Get that into your head, okay? You’re not going to lose me.’’

‘’Why do you think I’m not being myself?’’ he forces out. ‘’Tell me, Pepper. Why were you thinking I wasn’t being myself?’’

Pepper is slightly taken aback, but like the composed woman she is, she answers quickly and candidly enough. ‘’Well, it’s – because you flinch. You don’t seem to be comfortable, when I’m sleeping over. I thought you wanted this relationship, but so far, you haven’t tried a single time to have sex with me yet. And, Tony, I’m fine with taking it slow, if that’s what you want.’’

Tony sighs, closing his eyes for only a moment before meeting Pepper’s anxious ones again. He should know to expect it when people throw around ‘sex’ and ‘relationship’ in the same sentence, as if they’re synonyms. ‘’I’m not fine with taking it slow,’’ he says. ‘’And that means the exact opposite of what you think it’ll mean. Pepper, I don’t want to have sex. And it’s not because I don’t love you, or because I’m not attracted to you. I’m asexual.’’

‘’You’re – what?’’ Pepper says, tilting her head suddenly. ‘’But – everyone always –‘’

‘’I know,’’ Tony says, with a self-deprecating smile. ‘’Neat little trick, isn’t it? I haven’t ever had sex, Pepper. Tabloids are all lies, every single one. I’m a virgin, and I’m fine with that. Enough people are desperate to say they’ve slept with me, and it’s always been that way. I let it go on, because it’s easier like that. Thing is, I don’t want sex. It freaks me out. I don’t see the appeal.’’

Pepper is silent for a little while, and then takes his hands. ‘’Tony,’’ she says. ‘’This is not a turn of events I saw coming, honestly, with all the women I’ve ushered out of your house –‘’

‘’Very drunk,’’ Tony says. ‘’Honestly, it’s so easy.’’

Her lips quirk into a slight smile. ‘’Point is, I love you. If you don’t want to have sex, that’s fine. I love you for you, and I brought it up because I was afraid you were doubting our relationship.’’

‘’I’ve never been more certain about anything in my life,’’ Tony says quickly. ‘’I love you, Pepper. It’s just – I’ve never been in a real relationship. I don’t want you to leave.’’

‘’You’re an idiot,’’ she says, and kisses his head. ‘’We all have our boundaries, Tony. You just have to tell me where yours are. Are you okay with kissing?’’

‘’Definitely,’’ Tony says. ‘’Kisses and cuddles, my favourite things. Look, Pepper – I’m sorry. I know that sex is this thing that everyone universally wants, and people just assume you’re having it when you’re in a relationship. People assume you’re having it, anyway. I feel like I’m letting you down.’’

‘’You’re you, you couldn’t ever,’’ she says. ‘’I love you, Tony, okay? I’m just glad you told me.’’

‘’I wish I wanted it,’’ Tony mutters, leaning against her. ‘’I want to want it, okay? But I don’t. I really, really, really don’t. I don’t get why everyone is so focused on having sex.’’

She enfolds him in her arms. ‘’I love you, and that’s the most important thing,’’ she says. ‘’I want you to be comfortable, Tony. It’s going to be okay, Tony. You told me, I’m still here, we’re fine. I’m not going to force you to do anything you don’t want to do.’’

‘’But maybe you’ll leave,’’ he mutters, trying not to sound like a kicked puppy.

She kisses him, again. ‘’Maybe,’’ she says. ‘’We’ve only been dating for a few weeks, and I don’t know what will happen. But it won’t be because you’re asexual, Tony. And it won’t be without warning. You have no idea how much I love you, and I’m not giving up on you.’’

She is still holding him, though, pressing soft kisses against his hair, and he dares to hope. That maybe it’ll work out anyway, that Pepper will stay. She isn’t leaving now, certainly, she seems to be clinging to him even more closely than before. If he really believes that she means it, that she loves him, then maybe they’ll get through this, as well.

‘’It’s not going to change, you know that, right?’’ he asks.

‘’I don’t need you to change,’’ Pepper says firmly. ‘’I think you’re perfectly fine the way you are. I love all of you. All of you, Tony. And you may not believe that right now, but I do.’’

It helps, and Tony breathes.
